Package com.example.myurbanflix

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CreateAccountActivity
    This defines the Account Creation page, which takes input from text fields and compares to database to ensure no duplicate usernames/emails are being used, If new user fields are valid, creates a new user and pushes it to the database
    CreateReviewActivity
    This class manages the Create Review Activity using Firestore, in which users can create reviews if they are logged in, and push those reviews to the firestore; This class takes care of autopopulating some data like username and date, and suggests a field for the name of the movie depending on the query that brought it here; It also enforces strict character limits for all fields to ensure the formatting looks nice in the app
    ExampleInstrumentedTest
    Instrumented test, which will execute on an Android device.
    ExampleUnitTest
    Example local unit test, which will execute on the development machine (host).
    FirestoreAdapter<VH extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder>
    Class is used as a firebase adapter which wraps around recyclerview.adapter and optimizes recycler for user with google firebase
    FirestoreHelper
    Used to access the firestore database from one central location; Gives clients Queries from database matching particular search parameters they desire, and appropriately logs in users for the client (or keeps them logged out if they have invalid credentials).
    LoginActivity
    This defines the Login Activity page, which allows the user to input their credentials, and if they match, logs the user in and returns them home; Logging in allows the users to view their profiles (post history) as well as upvote, downvote, and create reviews; The page also contains a link to the create account page if the user does not have an account yet
    MainActivity
    This opens the home page and inits a connection to the firebase db in order to populate a local recycler view which the user can interact with; Upvotes and Downvotes are sent to the database and refreshed locally; SharedPreferences are also initialized here via the PreferencesHelper class
    MovieReview
    Defines a Movie Review for the purpose of pushing a review remotely to the database; The DB is able to parse Java objects, and thus we pass to it review objects generated in the CreateReviewActivity for it to parse and use to populate a firestore document containing the related data.
    MovieReviewAdapter
    This adapter is used for all recycler views in order to inflate movie_review_views and populate them with data from a firestore query (provided by helper); extra functionality allows for recycler to enable/disable upvote downvote buttons for particular views, such as the ViewAccountActivity, which we do not want to be able to mutate reviews
    MovieReviewTest
    Test Suite for the MovieReview class, tests all methods and asserts they perform actions as expected
    MovieSearchActivity
    This is the activity that is opened when a user searches for a particular movie, String 'message' contains the user query, so this activity uses that query to populate from our database a recycler view containing movie titles that match that query
    PreferencesHelper
    Acts as a helper (an interface) for other activities to use in order to access shared preferences Contains several overloaded methods for getting and setting particular preferences based on the type of the parameters given
    PreferencesHelperTest
    A test suite to test every method of the PreferencesHelper class using a dummy Context to enable unit testing outside of Android framework
    User
    This class is used to define a User as the database will understand it; When a user is created in the CreateAccountActivity class, the User is pushed to the database as a User object; The firestore will parse the object in order to generate a document which it will store remotely.
    UserTest
    Test Suite for testing User class methods
    ViewAccountActivity
    This activity allows the user to view their post history and log out if they so decide; Their post history is generated by a query to the database matching the user's credentials, and the recyclerview therein has disabled upvote/downvote buttons
